name: Nairobi
fun_fact: Fun fact: Nairobi is the ONLY capital city in the world with a national park inside its city limits! Nairobi National Park is just 10km from the CBD and is home to lions, rhinos, giraffes, and zebras grazing with skyscrapers in the background. The city is also home to the Giraffe Centre, which saved the Rothschild's giraffe from extinction - these unique giraffes have THREE horns instead of two!

hero_dishes.name: Nyama Choma
hero_dishes.description: Kenya's most famous dish - slow-roasted meat (usually goat, but also beef or chicken) over open fire until tender and smoky, served on communal platters
hero_dishes.origin_story: The name means 'roasted meat' in Swahili. Traditionally eaten on special occasions like weekend family gatherings. In Kenya, it's generally the men who do the outdoor grilling. Best paired with ugali and kachumbari, encouraging sharing and conversation
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Njuguna's Place (Waiyaki Way, Westlands - top-three mention by locals), Kenyatta Market (lunchtime stalls with goat and chicken), Nerkwo Restaurant (South B, off Mombasa Road - designated weekend spot for stressed workers). Pair with Tusker beer!

hero_dishes.name: Ugali
hero_dishes.description: The heart of Kenyan cuisine - dense, dough-like staple made from maize flour and water, served as a side to nearly every meal
hero_dishes.origin_story: Deeply satisfying and symbolizes home cooking and togetherness. Eaten with your hands by breaking off small pieces, forming balls, and using them to scoop stew or vegetables. Though simple, it's the foundation of Kenyan meals
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Served everywhere from roadside eateries to high-end restaurants. Always accompanies nyama choma and sukuma wiki

hero_dishes.name: Githeri
hero_dishes.description: Traditional hearty mix of boiled maize (corn) and beans, simple yet nutritious, seasoned with salt and sometimes vegetables
hero_dishes.origin_story: Originated from the Kikuyu community (Kenya's largest ethnic group), now a national favorite representing home-cooked comfort food
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Local eateries and home-style restaurants throughout Nairobi

hero_dishes.name: Kachumbari
hero_dishes.description: Fresh, zingy salad of chopped onions, tomatoes, cilantro, chili, and lemon juice - the go-to side for grilled meats
hero_dishes.origin_story: This uncooked relish balances rich, fatty foods with bright acidity and crunch. Essential with nyama choma, pilau, and samosas
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Accompanies nyama choma at all the major spots - automatically served with grilled meats

signature_drinks.name: Dawa Cocktail
signature_drinks.description: Kenya's de facto national cocktail - vodka, white rum, honey, and lime juice served over ice with a wooden Dawa stick for stirring
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Created in the 1980s at The Carnivore restaurant in Nairobi. 'Dawa' means 'medicine' in Swahili - a rejuvenating tonic in hot weather. Inspired by Brazilian caipirinha but featuring honey (fitting for a country with long beekeeping traditions). The signature wooden stick is used to add honey and stir. There's also a non-alcoholic version (hot water, honey, lemon, ginger) used as a cold/flu remedy

signature_drinks.name: Kenyan Chai
signature_drinks.description: Sweet, milky tea prepared with milk, water, sugar, and tea leaves - an essential start to every Kenyan day
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Kenyans start their day with chai, accompanied by bread, cake, pancakes, sweet potatoes, or arrowroots

signature_drinks.name: Tusker Beer
signature_drinks.description: Kenya's iconic lager, tailored to Kenyan preferences and part of the country's brewing traditions
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: The perfect pairing with nyama choma. Also popular: White Cap and Pilsner lagers

food_culture_notes: Nyama choma is best on weekends as a social gathering ritual
Ugali is eaten with hands - this is traditional and expected
Most dishes are designed for communal sharing and conversation
Kenya has a sizable Indian population, so chapati and mandazi show Indian influence
Sukuma Wiki means 'to push the week' - helps stretch meals through tough times
Tilapia from Lake Victoria is deep-fried whole for special occasions

landmarks: Nairobi National Park (only wildlife capital in the world)
Giraffe Centre (Rothschild's giraffe sanctuary with famous 'kiss of life')
atmosphere: Wildlife and urban life coexisting uniquely
Social weekend gatherings around communal food
Over 400 bird species in national park
colors: Wildlife earth tones with city greys
unique_modern: Lions and giraffes with skyscraper backdrop
Rothschild's giraffes with three horns (unique to species)
50,000+ Kenyan students visit Giraffe Centre annually for free education
Successful rhino sanctuary in urban national park
Dawa cocktail created 1980s, now national drink
The Carnivore restaurant as cultural institution
